title: Help identifying this decorative serif
content:
The dot over the i was replaced by a decorative element, which I omitted.

Font: 

 Comenius Antiqua Medium (modified) 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120718/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [436721.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120718/http:/typophile.com/files/436721.gif) | 4.07 KB |
author: supe22

comments.content: It looks like a modified **[Comenius Antiqua (Medium)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120718/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Berthold%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Comenius%20Antiqua%20-%20Medium&fid=6187f25dc11549aa2f79d19199627a74&fsize=60&text=Be%20Light&fit=1)** by Hermann Zapf [Berthold, 1976]
I suspected the decorative elements might have been mods. The slanted connectors on the B were throwing me when I tried to locate the original font. Thanks so much, fvilanakis!
